Class SKAnnotation

public class SKAnnotation
extends java.lang.Object

Stores information about an annotation

Method Detail

getLocation

public SKCoordinate getLocation()
Returns the gps location for the annotation.

Returns:
the gps location for the annotation. See SKCoordinate

setLocation

public void setLocation(SKCoordinate location)
Sets the location for the annotation.

Parameters:
location - new location for the annotation. See SKCoordinate

getImagePath

public java.lang.String getImagePath()
Returns the absolute path for the image set to be an annotation.

Returns:
a string containing the absolute path of the image.

setImagePath

public void setImagePath(java.lang.String imagePath)
Sets the absolute path of the image file to be added as an annotation. The image must be a square image and the size must be a power of 2 ( 32x32, 64x64, etc).

getImageSize

public int getImageSize()
Return the image size.

Returns:
the image size.

setImageSize

public void setImageSize(int imageSize)
Sets the size of the image (width and height) in pixels. By default is 0.

Parameters:
imageSize -

getUniqueID

public int getUniqueID()
Returns the unique id of the annotation. Please make sure that you use unique ID's.

Returns:
unique id of the annotation.

setUniqueID

public void setUniqueID(int uniqueID)
Sets an unique ID for the annotation. Please make sure that you use unique ID's.

Parameters:
uniqueID - new unique id

getAnnotationType

public int getAnnotationType()
Returns the type of annotation.

Returns:
an int representing the type of annotation. If the type is not valid the annotation will not be drawn.

setAnnotationType

public void setAnnotationType(int annotationType)
Sets the annotation type. See constants like SK_ANNOTATION_TYPE_BLUE or others.

Parameters:
annotationType - annotation type. If new textures will be added in the json file annotationType represents the textureID of the new image.

getMininumZoomLevel

public int getMininumZoomLevel()
Returns the minimum zoom level where the annotation will be visible. By default is 4.

Returns:
the minimum zoom level where the annotation will be visible. By default is 4.

setMininumZoomLevel

public void setMininumZoomLevel(int mininumZoomLevel)
Sets the minimum zoom level where the annotation will be visible. By default is 4.

Parameters:
mininumZoomLevel - new minimum zool level where the annotation is visible.

getOffset

public SKScreenPoint getOffset()
Returns the offset of the annotation with image.

Returns:
the offset of the annotation with image

setOffset

public void setOffset(SKScreenPoint offset)
Sets the offset for the annotation added using an image. Use this property for positioning the annotation image around the location. It has effect just when the annotation is added by giving an absolute path for the annotation or when adding it using SKAnnotationView , not by type.

Parameters:
offset -

getAnnotationView

public SKAnnotationView getAnnotationView()
Returns the view or drawable resource that is rendered with this annotation.

Returns:
the view or drawable resource that is rendered with this annotation

setAnnotationView

public void setAnnotationView(SKAnnotationView annotationView)
Sets the view or drawable resource to be rendered with this annotation.

Parameters:
annotationView - new annotation view that has to be drawn.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
